# Week 12

# 11/05 - The Classical Minuet

Reminder: HW 8 is due before class

Reminder: HW 9 is due on Friday!

Today four of the AIs will present the late-eighteenth-century minuet, which was the most important social dance of the period, as well as being used as the third movement of symphonies, string quartets, and other similar pieces.

Presentation

  • The minuet as a genre
  • The minuet from Mozart, Quartet in GM, K.156
  • The minuet from Haydn, Symphony 104
  • Hypermeter

# 11/06 - Drill

In drill today we'll:

  • Review the Sentence and Period
  • Practice harmonic analysis
  • Work a bit with Hypermeter

Additional Score: Mozart, Symphony in Gm, K.550, minuet

# 11/07 - Larger Binary Forms

Today we'll introduce the concept of "Topics". Then we'll look at a slightly larger Binary form movement: the first movement of one of Mozart's early "Milanese" String Quartets. The form is still the same as it was in the minuets from Monday and Tuesday, but we'll see that Mozart does more to dramatize the key "moves" of that form.

(No slides today.)

  • Topics
  • Rounded Binary Form Review
  • Mozart, K.156, i: Presto (CP 59)

Handout: Smaller Binary Forms

Handout: Larger Binary Forms

# 11/08 - Drill

In drill today we'll review binary form terminology, and then study the slow movement from the little Mozart Quartet in G.

# 11/09 - Sonata Form

Reminder: HW 9 is due before lecture!

Reminder: HW 10 is due in drill next Thursday!

And today we'll officially start looking at Sonata Form. We've already discussed a sonata-form movement using the terminology for rounded binary form, so the general principles here will be familiar. But today we'll be introducing the standard terminology for sonata form itself, some of which is review from T152 and some of which is probably new.

Handout: Sonata Form

  • Mozart, Quartet in G major, K. 387
    • Exposition
      • P - m.1
      • TR - m.11
      • S - m.25
      • C - m.39
    • Development
      • Retransition-ish - mm. 90-107
    • Recapitulation
  • Mozart, Symphony no. 40 in G minor, K.550
    • Exposition
      • P
      • TR - m.20
      • S - m.44
      • C - m.66
    • Development
      • Retransition
    • Recapitulation
      • P
      • TR
      • S
      • C
    • Coda
